Package pl.polsl.lab1.krzysztof.gach.controller

package pl.polsl.lab1.krzysztof.gach.controller
Provides the controller components of the application, following the Model-View-Controller (MVC) design pattern. This package is responsible for managing the flow of data between the model and the view. It contains classes that handle user input, update the model based on that input, and refresh the view to reflect any changes. Key classes in this package include:
  • ArgumentParser: Parses command-line arguments and validates their format for use within the application.
  • Controller: Manages the game logic and interactions between the model and view components, ensuring the correct flow of data.
  • Game: Represents the overall game state and logic, coordinating gameplay activities and player interactions.
  • GameInstance: Manages an instance of the game, including initializing game settings, tracking the current state, and managing player turns.
Classes in this package work between the model and view packages to create an organized application structure.
  • Class
    Description
    ArgumentParser
    The ArgumentParser class is responsible for parsing command line arguments from a given input string.
    Controller
    The Controller class is responsible for managing the game flow and handling user input for the console-based game.
    Game
    The Game class implements the GameInstance interface and manages the game logic, including initializing the game board and players, starting the game, and handling player turns.
    GameInstance
    The GameInstance interface defines the contract for game instances, specifying the essential operations required to manage a game.
    GameState
    Represents the various states of the game.
    Validator
    The Validator class provides validation methods for game settings, including board size and player details.
    Validator.ValidationStatus
    Enum representing validation status outcomes for the game setup.
